Reviews.Title: Good Phone: Touch screen is a bit lagging
Reviews.Author: E. Estrada "Single Dad of 4"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone from two different vendors to replace mine and my daughter's cell. I gave the first one (from Masterdeals) to my daughter because her old phone was really acting up. It works really well, so I ordered another from Unlocked Cell Phone Kings.The first phone has been working flawlessly for my daughter, the second phone starting acting up only a week and a half later. I called Unlocked Cell Phone Kings and they emailed me a RMA form. It took two weeks to get replacement from when I sent the defective unit back.I bought a new phone, but recieved a refurbished phone.  It "looks" new, but was in a plain jane box and the screen shipping protector was too big, over hanging the phone. However, this phone has worked pretty much flawlessly. The touch screen is a bit "lagging", but works well.Obviously, I recieved a lemon. It happens from time to time and I do not blame the seller for that.  But getting a refurb when I bought a new phone and also having to put my SIM card in youngest's phone and use it for two weeks, instead of doing an advance replacement, is why they recieve 4 stars.This phone is set up for AT&T;, but I am using it on T-mobile network. LG did not have any updates or way to reprogram the AT&T; features out. I had to work around the programming to get to the web. I never thought I would say this but Cricket's web browser is much easier and more intuative. With the Xexon browser, I have had to sit in front of my computer to find the mobile sites and manually enter the URL then save the page. And for 3G its really slow. The old cricket was 3G much faster.Also when sending text messages, this phone does not automatically convert to SMS if you only have an email address listed in your contacts. Another text message issue is that some sites (not full phone numbers) you have to enter the "key word" in the subject box instead of the text window for the partial number sites to register or read your message.It runs Java, but cannot read barcodes though I was able to download a free app, the phone will not allow it to access the camera. The 2MP camera has an LED flash and takes nice little low res snap shots to post on social media sites. My daughter showed me that there is a basic photo editing features to "fix" pic before posting them. I can even access FB (Facebook) and post updates, but I did have to set up my account and phone to talk to each other. I mostly access the weather, maps and gas prices.With all that said, this is great little texting/messaging phone with a touch screen. I like the calender, alarm clock and calculator (for calculating gas milage and cost value of food at the store).  The calculator behaves like a standard calculator.I would recommend this phone for voice, messaging and light web browsing.UPDATE 16 February 2012: Reduced rating to 3 Stars. Battery crashed/shorted out internally. Wonder if battery was a used one because replacement cell phone is only 3 months old and Battery should have lasted one year at least. Sent an e-mail message to seller. Waiting on Reply. Its a Holiday weekend (President's day) so I will give them an extra day or two.UPDATE 25 February 2012: Did not recieve any acknowledgement to the email stating battery had failed. However, recieved a replacement battery today from Unlocked Cell Phone Kings. Customer Service is not good at communicating, but they do try to "fix the issue". Returning rating to 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: LG xenon
Reviews.Author: awc
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to order a phone online, yet an unlocked one, for fear it would not work as portrayed.  This LG xenon from Unlocked Cell Phone Kings was promised to work with GSM carrier, AT&T; and T-mobile.  I have T-mobile, put in my sim card and the service was active, no problems.  Two choices to text, slide out Qwerty keyboard, or touch screen, not Qwerty. Unlock button and lock button on the side, so it doesn't dial out by accident. Automatically locks after a few seconds of no use, but you can change in settings to never lock, except manually when you decide to lock it.  Can be annoying when it constantly locks up after 15-45 seconds.  I prefer to be in charge of locking and unlocking. Many settings to change volume, choice of tones, can choose separate tones/alerts for texts vs. call coming in.This phone does not come with a car charger, which I knew, so you may want to order it along with the phone, sometimes as a package deal, and/or with a silicone cover.  It is on the slippery side like a lot of phones. The only feature I can't get to work is a picture text message.  It says push "Get" to download, which I did, and it will not retrieve.  I did not have data on my 7 year old dinosaur phone, and got picture messages, so not sure why a new up to date phone would not be able to retrieve a text pic message.  I will have to take that up with T-mobile to see if we can resolve this issue. Many features on this phone, just takes some getting used to as I have never had a touch phone.  It vibrates everytime you touch screen and move it, but that also can be remedied in the settings, to decrease the vibration, or do away with it.So far the only thing I don't like about the phone is when replying to a text, and when you hit send, it just goes.  My old phone would show me the number to confirm, and then I would say OK and then it would send.  I like the confirmation to make sure you are replying to the right person, but this phone just sends.I would order again from Unlocked Cell Phone Kings.  This phone arrived one day earlier than promised, and it only took 4 days from order date to arrival date. They answered all emails I had with questions prior to the actual order of the phone.

Reviews.Title: Feels like a toy, Works like a phone
Reviews.Author: Wameng Vue "Wa_Wii"
Reviews.Content: I was skeptic about buying this phone at first, but it has proven to be workable so far. I would recommend this phone to others, especially those who lose it easily like me. It works well, looks nice, great for txting (except when it takes forever to load), and although the camera is only 2MP the quality is really good. The touch screen is a bit unresponsive, but it's what a first generation touch screen phone should be like so no biggy. I've dropped it a few times, and it has produced a bit of a jingle when the phone vibrates, but according to other listeners, I'm the only who can hear it. Overall, this phone is good for its price.P.S. it comes with phone strap holes so that's a plus (can't find many phones nowadays with those XD)

Reviews.Title: Okay for temporary use
Reviews.Author: rauwolfia
Reviews.Content: I got this phone a few days back and it looks okay, just like in the pictures. I don't use a contract so I wanted an unlocked phone where I will be able to use internet and this phone fulfills that purpose. I also got this phone because I wanted QWERTY with touchscreen but its touchscreen works horribly. I have used a lot of touch screen phones before and I can claim that it has the worst touch screen ever. This phone is also not that easy to use so I can say that it's not one of the best user friendly phones. Overall I would not recommend this phone to people who wants it for a long term use. If it is used as a temporary phone with easy text, calling and internet access features then it won't be too bad for that. Also you need to buy separate headphones for this phone. It only comes with a charger and battery.

Reviews.Title: missing buttons
Reviews.Author: missygirl
Reviews.Content: Bought a "brand new" phone and I got it with buttons missing on it. And I had to pay to ship it back to return it.

Reviews.Title: LG Unlocked Phone
Reviews.Author: joymbm
Reviews.Content: I purchased the LG phone and I have been pleased with it.  It was delivered very quickly and I haven't had any problems.  I love the keypad for texting.  It is so easy and yet you still have the touch screen which is great.  I have been very pleased.

Reviews.Title: The boy loves it
Reviews.Author: kahjo80
Reviews.Content: It was a great purchase for my son.  I never knew you could buy a cell phone like that.  He loves the phone.  It was a great price.  I would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone for the price!
Reviews.Author: petesura
Reviews.Content: 2 Thumbs up!!! I bought this phone to replace an old iPhone with a broken screen - and I didn't want to break the bank. Needless to say, this phone has been awesome! For under $100, it is far more than what I expected. Very easy to use and a nice looking phone.

Reviews.Title: Great for Price
Reviews.Author: Ramesh
Reviews.Content: LG makes an affordable and great touch screen phone. Easy to use and good key response. I love this phone and would recommend it for anyone on low budget for touch screen and good quality.

Reviews.Title: do not buy phone u will b sending it back
Reviews.Author: john p
Reviews.Content: I bought phone 2 weeks ago and had to send back today.The screen on it froze up and then it went blurry. now i am without phone again and now i have to wait to get my money back to buy another phone. i will not be buying anything again on line over this phone. the best thing to do is spend the extra money at a store that you can go back to and return item to. words can not express how frustrating this is. the phone is priced cheap cause it is a cheaply made phone.So please "DO NOT BUY" or you will be going through the same frustrating process that im going through right now "DO NOT BUY"

Reviews.Title: doesn't work
Reviews.Author: lmoody
Reviews.Content: The first week I had this phone, it was awesome. After that, it just shutdown. I can no longer turn it on. I tried to find a way to send it back,but to no avail.Please advise...........Signed... disgruntle customer.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase for the buck
Reviews.Author: Bargin Shopper
Reviews.Content: I was so unsure about purchasing this phone.  I had a Dell Venue for only about 6 months and lost it. After investing $299 in phone. I decided not to buy another expensive phone just something I can talk, text and surf the web. To my surprise I have been able to do all these features and link with my email account too!  I love this little phone!  It works well with ATT sim card in our area.

Reviews.Title: pretty nice
Reviews.Author: teenager.
Reviews.Content: I've gotten this phone twice, one was brand new and lasted my a long time till my continuous dropping made all the side keys fall out and eventually broke it, but during that time it was great, very nice and dependable, the battery life was great as well. Then recently I bought this phone again after loosing an evergreen phone, it was used and SUCKED. It came in an indent in the screen which sometimes prevented the touchscreen from working and the battery life which used to last for roughly 5 days was just barely making it through to 2 days (with no calls and a few texts a day). But, as for the phone itself I LOVE to text on it, the keyboard it great and I can text very fast with it and I like the way it displays the texts from one person on a thread. I also like the way the address book is set up and it is easy to find and sent multiple texts to people. Overall, pretty good phone, I recommend it to those who love to text and not much else; those who don't want the distractions of a smart phone and don't care for much except communicating with others.

Reviews.Title: this phone is horrible
Reviews.Author: hd415
Reviews.Content: when i first got this phone I was all excited. It was exactly what i wanted touch with a full keyboard. Well its like a big toy first off. i can look past that. the menu stopped working no matter what I tried, its unbelievably slow, and the short cuts on the home screen stopped working. All i can use it for is txt and calling. that's not to bad but it's irritating i cant use the calendar, or calculator, music, or even my pictures. the worst is how slow it is. I press view to see my incoming txt then put the phone down and come back rather than wait for it to finally pop up.I'm not sure if its the phone or service issues but my calls are getting dropped, I'm not receiving messages, and i don't get reception. These problems only started when I got this phone.

Reviews.Title: qwerty phone
Reviews.Author: Linda K "lindamk11"
Reviews.Content: This phone is a classic good cell phone. I like that it has the full keyboard for fast easy texting. It also has smart phone characteristics, a camera, voicemail, etc. The charger is simple and the battery lasts a long time. Both red and blue colors are good-looking.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone
Reviews.Author: Rwwmson
Reviews.Content: I had one of these for myself at one time and decided to get one for my granddaughter. Good durable phone that is easy to text with. Sliding qwerty keyboard is great

Reviews.Title: Did not work well for a T-Mobile account
Reviews.Author: David Clark
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a 'hi-jacked' phone because it would save us money.  It misses a lot of calls.  That is likely because it was not originally for a T-Mobile account.  Otherwise, it is a good phone.

Reviews.Title: Not a fan
Reviews.Author: Aja B
Reviews.Content: I got these for my mom and she hates it, has lots of issues with it working correctly I would not buy this phone again

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: North Philly Girl "NPG"
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and very functional  phone.  I got one for myself and my son, and we are both very happy.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone.
Reviews.Author: Maria Snodgrass
Reviews.Content: Nice phone but the battery life is horrible. It is a good phone otherwise.  I don't like the internet button being right by the Caps button though.  I don't use the internet so I have to really watch what I am doing while texting.

Reviews.Title: Wack!
Reviews.Author: Tisha
Reviews.Content: I got this phone because mines broke. However, when the phone arrived I was glad. When I opened the box, the phone was smaller than I thought! This phone is great for a teen but not for adults. The touch pad is poor, you will have to really press hard on the screen for it to work. In addition, the phone freezes up and you will have to remove the battery and replace it to get the phone rolling again. With this said, you get what you pay for and it is good for a back up but never a main phone!

Reviews.Title: LG Xenon
Reviews.Author: Sammy L. Burnham
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement phone for my wife, so far she has been very pleased with the phone, so much in fact that I purchased one for myself. Depending what you are looking for in a phone this just might be for you. We are both very satisfied with ours.

Reviews.Title: Too many AT&T; proprietary functions
Reviews.Author: Miguel Verde
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone to use on a trip to Costa Rica... it works perfectly here.. no issues with the phone at all.  The drawback is that there are too many pre-installed proprietary software programs, email, messaging, etc that will definitely get in the way during your travel.. they are all useless anywhere but on an ATT network.  The button to activate the ATT email is just to the left of the letter "A" and i am constantly accidently activating the email program in the middle of a text message.. its extremely frustrating... the phone works, but i would recommend a more generic phone if you are making international travel...

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: mrszman
Reviews.Content: received the phone quickly, it works perfect. I'm not a big fan of the touch screen, but that's just me. The phones are nice.

Reviews.Title: dont like the LG XENON CELL PHONE
Reviews.Author: bugsgurl
Reviews.Content: The LG XENON Cell phone is not what I expected. It does not ring loud enough for me to hear it. I can't receive any of my emails nor my facebook information on it. I can't even receive my gmail account. The worst part is I can't open any of the following up. I hate the color of it also. I wanted the blue or purple one.

Reviews.Title: i love lg xenon iam ordering it for the first so i hope it works it cameout in 2009 so lets find out
Reviews.Author: marciella
Reviews.Content: i love the lg  xenon iam buying it for the first time for me my son has it and he says it is a good phone he gives it 4 out of 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Good phone but too small for my fingers
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: The phone is actually a great, but I am a pretty big guy, so my fingers are always hitting 2 or 3 buttons on the touch screen at once. It's pretty frustrating sometimes. Other than that it's a pretty good phone

Reviews.Title: Not touch friendly..
Reviews.Author: stl
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not comparable with any other decent touch phones out there. The phone in itself works fine, but is not touch friendly. The phone does not look so good as in the picture, and the red outline looks cheap. Its not worth the money to get this one. Quite disappointed with the product.

Reviews.Title: LG XENON cell phone
Reviews.Author: JK/RCP
Reviews.Content: Using a newer model of phone after years of a "Go Phone" presents it's challenges & my learning curve is a little prolonged.

Reviews.Title: garbage phone
Reviews.Author: dillon
Reviews.Content: i just revieved this phone today, it was a total waste of money, the features on the phone are pretty good. right out of the box this brand new phone shuts off every ten to twenty minutes on its own so i am definetly not satisfied with this purchase

Reviews.Title: phone charger damaged
Reviews.Author: cortez
Reviews.Content: The phone charger that came with this phone did not work.  The electrical wire looked like it was pulled from the socket by the cord rather than the plug causing the wire to fray. This raised questions about whether the phone is new or used.Aside from this--the phone worked as it was described--but it was disappointing to buy a phone with a defective charger and that's why I gave it a low rating.

Reviews.Title: Ehh
Reviews.Author: a
Reviews.Content: They wouldn't lie about the product but still always pay attetion to what your buying because overall was satified with what i bought but was missing some key features on the phone

ProductInfo.Features:
This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported. It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint.
3G-powered smartphone in blue with 2.8-inch touchscreen and slide-out QWERTY keyboard; customizable and intuitive user interface
Compatible with AT&T; Navigator GPS, Video Share, AT&T; Mobile Music, and streaming video from Cellular Video service
2-megapixel camera/camcorder, Bluetooth stereo music; MicroSD expansion (to 16 GB); digital audio/video player
Up to 4 hours of talk time, up to 264 hours (11 days) of standby time
ProductInfo.Name: LG XENON Unlocked Phone with Touch Screen, QWERTY Keyboard, 2MP Camera and GPS
